1.question: What method was used to track the fate of NK cells in vivo after recruitment into solid tumors?

options.B: Photo-labeling

2.question: What was the main finding regarding NK cells after they entered the tumor microenvironment?

options.B: They rapidly lost effector functions
options.E: They migrated out of the tumor

3.question: Which cytokine administration was found to prevent the loss of NK cell function and improve tumor control?

options.B: IL-6

4.question: What characteristic did intratumoral NK cells adopt after recruitment into tumors?

options.B: Decreased expression of CD49a

5.question: What was the effect of NK cell depletion from established tumors on tumor growth?

options.B: It had no impact on tumor growth

6.question: Which integrin expression was used to distinguish cNK cells from tissue-resident NK cells and ILC1?

options.B: CD49b

7.question: What was the main conclusion regarding the role of TGFβ and PGE2 in NK cell function within tumors?

options.B: They completely recapitulate the tumor-retained NK cell phenotype in vitro
options.C: They partially recapitulate the tumor-retained NK cell phenotype in vitro
options.D: They have no effect on NK cell function

8.question: What was the effect of IL-15:IL-15Ra complexes on NK cells within tumors?

options.B: They increased NK cell apoptosis
options.C: They enhanced NK cell effector functions
options.E: They had no effect on NK cells

9.question: What was the observed effect of hypoxia on NK cell effector functions in vitro?

options.B: Complete loss of effector functions
options.C: Very modest changes in integrin and granzyme expression

10.question: What was the main finding regarding NK cells in human colorectal cancer (CRC) tumors?

options.B: They adopted a resting, non-activated state
options.C: They were absent from the tumors
options.D: They were the main effector cells controlling tumor growth
options.E: They were more active than in normal tissue

11.question: What was the effect of IL-15:IL-15Ra treatment on the phenotype of NK cells in tumors?

options.A: It caused a decrease in CD49a expression
options.B: It resulted in the emergence of a CD49a+ CD11b+ population
options.C: It led to the loss of CD11b expression
options.D: It had no effect on NK cell phenotype

12.question: What was the main method used to analyze the transcriptomic changes in NK cells over time?

options.B: Mass spectrometry

13.question: What was the main finding regarding the expression of CD49a and CD11b in NK cells over time in the tumor?

options.B: CD11b expression increased over time
options.C: CD49a expression increased and CD11b expression decreased over time
options.D: Both CD49a and CD11b expression increased over time
options.E: Both CD49a and CD11b expression decreased over time

14.question: What was the effect of NK cell depletion on tumor growth in the absence of T cells?

options.B: It had no impact on tumor growth

15.question: What was the main finding regarding the role of HIF-1α in NK cell function within tumors?

options.A: HIF-1α deletion significantly impaired tumor growth
options.B: HIF-1α deletion had no significant impact on NK cell function
options.C: HIF-1α deletion enhanced NK cell cytotoxicity
options.D: HIF-1α deletion increased NK cell migration
options.E: HIF-1α deletion reduced NK cell numbers

options.A: They are ineffective in enhancing NK cell function
options.B: They can block the loss of NK cell functions in the TME
options.C: They reduce NK cell numbers in tumors
options.D: They have no effect on tumor growth

options.B: Inhibitory receptor expression remained constant over pseudotime

options.D: Inhibitory receptor expression was not analyzed
